abstract.p: The purpose of this paper is to describe and motivate the leading ideas behind the MiMo notation, a formalism for transfer-based machine translation which is especially appropriate for intermediate representations based on Dependency Grammar. The most important of these ideas concern properties of the translation relation such as compositionality, reversibility, modularity, and autonomy of levels of description. The final section considers some issues relating to rule interaction.
